intro: Geostachys tratensis, commonly known as the Trat geostachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
